contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox President | name =Nicole Fontaine | image = | order =20th |office = President of the European Parliament | term_start =20 July 1999 | term_end =15 January 2002 | vicepresident = | predecessor =[[José María Gil-Robles]] | successor =[[Pat Cox]] | birth_date ={{Birth date and age|1942|1|16|df=y}} | birth_place =[[Grainville-Ymauville]], France | death_date = | death_place = | party =[[Union for a Popular Movement|UMP]];<br/>[[European People's Party|EPP]] | spouse =Jean-René Fontaine | profession =lawyer | religion =Roman Catholic | signature = |}} '''Nicole Fontaine''' (born 16 January 1942 in [[Grainville-Ymauville]], Seine-Maritime) is a French politician and [[Member of the European Parliament]] for the [[Île-de-France]]. She is a member of the [[Union for a Popular Movement]], part of the [[European People's Party]]. Fontaine was the [[President of the European Parliament]] from 1999 to 2001, and was then replaced by [[Pat Cox]], from the [[European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party]], in accordance with an agreement between the two groups at the start of the term. ==References== * [http://www.europarl.europa.eu/members/archive/term6/view.do?language=EN&id=945 European Parliament website entry] *{{cite news|title=Nicole Fontaine: a European conciliator-general|date=28 August 1999|work=The Economist}} {{EuroparlPres}} {{Members of the European Parliament 2004–2009}} {{Authority control|VIAF=41840057}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Fontaine, Nicole | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French MEP | DATE OF BIRTH =16 January 1942 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Grainville-Ymauville]], France | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fontaine, Nicole}} [[Category:1942 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Seine-Maritime]] [[Category:Sciences Po alumni]] [[Category:French women in politics]] [[Category:Presidents of the European Parliament]] [[Category:MEPs for Île-de-France 2004–2009]] [[Category:Female MEPs for France]] [[Category:Union for a Popular Movement MEPs]] [[Category:MEPs for France 1999–2004]] {{France-MEP-stub}}
